verses.text: 我要站在哨崗，立在城樓，留心看耶和華在我裡面說甚麼，怎樣使我答覆自己的怨訴。

words.note: A lookout post or watch tower.
A fortified tower on a city wall.
Lit. 'keep heart/mind'.
A more formal term for 'reply' or 'respond'.
Formal term for expressing a complaint.

verses.text: 耶和華回答我說：「把異象寫下，記在泥版上，使讀的人容易明白，

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb.
A supernatural or prophetic vision.
Writing material in ancient Near East.
Locative suffix indicating 'on'.
Forms a nominal phrase 'the one who reads'.

verses.heading: The Lord Assures Habakkuk

verses.text: 因這異象關乎一定的日期，很快就要實現，決不徒然；縱有遲延，仍當等候，因為它一定會來到，絕不耽誤。」

words.note: More formal than 關於 (guānyú).
Formal term meaning 'without result or purpose'.
A formal way to say 'even though'.
Formal term for 'delay'.
Often implies patient or expectant waiting.
Verb complement indicating arrival or completion.

verses.text: 迦勒底人自高自大，心不正直；然而義人必因信得生（「必因信得生」或譯：「必因他的信實得生」）。

words.note: Idiomatic expression meaning 'self-important and arrogant'.
Formal conjunction.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Often refers to religious faith in this context.
To receive or experience life, often spiritual.
Quality of being trustworthy and true to promises.

verses.text: 財富（傳統作「酒」，今照死海古卷譯作「財富」）使人奸詐狂傲，不得安寧；擴張慾望，如同陰間；又像死亡，永不滿足。他們招聚萬國，集合萬民，都歸自己。

words.note: Literary or formal use of 'now'.
Ancient manuscripts found near the Dead Sea.
Describes excessive pride and arrogance.
Often means 'cannot obtain' or 'cannot achieve'.
The realm of the dead, Sheol/Hades.
Combines 'forever' and 'not'.
Formal term for gathering or convening.
Literally 'ten thousand nations'.
Literally 'ten thousand peoples'.

verses.text: 這些國民豈不都用譬喻、諷刺、暗語指著他們說：「那些濫得他人財物的，滿載別人抵押品的，有禍了！他們這樣要到幾時呢？」

words.note: Used to form rhetorical questions.
Refers to obscure or difficult-to-understand speech.
Implies acquiring wealth unjustly or greedily.
抵押 is a common compound for 'mortgage/pledge'.
A common biblical exclamation.

verses.heading: The Proud Babylonians are as Good as Dead

verses.text: 你的債主（「你的債主」或譯：「咬你的」）豈不忽然起來？擾亂你的豈不醒起？你就成了他們的擄物。

words.note: Common in Bible footnotes for alternative translations.
Here 'the one who bites you'.
Used to form rhetorical questions.
Here 'the one who troubles you'.
Used to form rhetorical questions.
Often used in a metaphorical sense for becoming aware or active.

verses.text: 因你搶掠多國，殺人流血，向全地各城施行暴力，所以剩下的人也必搶掠你。

words.note: Often refers to violent taking of property.
Often implies violence and loss of life.

words.definition: the whole earth, all the land

breakdown.m: by means of, in order to

verses.text: 你這為自己的家積聚不義之財，在高處搭窩，以逃避災害的，有禍了！

words.note: Used here demonstratively, referring to 'you' as 'this one'.
Classical Chinese equivalent of '的', used for formal or literary style.

words.definition: build a nest, make a home
words.note: Figurative: to establish oneself securely, often for selfish gain.

words.definition: in order to, so as to
words.note: Connects an action with its purpose.
Forms a noun phrase from the preceding clause, referring to 'the one who...'
A common biblical exclamation.

verses.text: 你剪除多國的民，反害了自己；你所謀算的，使你的家蒙羞。

words.note: Implies violent or complete eradication.
Transforms a verb into a noun phrase, meaning 'that which is V-ed'.
Forms a noun phrase from the preceding clause, here 'what you planned'.

verses.text: 石頭必從牆裡呼叫，梁木必在樹中應聲。
你這用人血做城，憑邪惡立鎮的，有禍了！

words.note: An exclamation of impending doom or judgment.

verses.text: 眾民勞碌得來的，被火焚燒；列國辛勞而得的，終歸無有。這不都出於萬軍之耶和華嗎？

words.note: Classic expression for 'nothingness' or 'to cease to exist'.
A divine title for God, meaning 'Yahweh of armies'.

verses.text: 認識耶和華之榮耀的知識，必充滿全地，好像眾水遮蓋海洋一樣。

words.note: Classical Chinese possessive/attributive particle.

verses.text: 你這請鄰舍喝酒，卻把毒物混入，使他醉倒，為要見他赤裸的，有禍了！

words.definition: get dead drunk, fall over drunk
in order to, for the purpose of

words.note: An exclamation of impending doom or judgment.

verses.text: 你滿有羞辱，沒有尊榮，你也喝到露出下體來吧！耶和華右手的杯必傳回來給你，使極大的羞辱取代你的尊榮。

words.note: Refers to genitals in this context.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.

verses.text: 因你向黎巴嫩使用暴力，殺滅驚嚇野獸；又殺人流血，向全地各城居民施行暴力，就必受到報應（「報應」原文作「遮蓋」）。
雕刻的像有甚麼用處呢？不過是匠人雕刻出來的；鑄造的像、虛假的教師，有甚麼用處呢？匠人竟倚靠自己所做，那不能說話的假神。

words.note: Indicates the object of the verb or agent of action.

verses.text: 你這對木頭說「起來」，對啞石說「醒吧」的人，有禍了！它怎能教導你呢？看哪！它包金鑲銀，裡面卻全無氣息。

words.note: A common biblical phrase to pronounce a curse or warning.

verses.text: 然而耶和華在他的聖殿裡，全地當在他面前肅靜。
